Question: In 1779, at the age of thirty-six, this person was elected Governor of Virginia by the two houses of the legislature.
Hints: This person has been memorialized in many ways, including buildings, sculptures, and currency.
In the following three weeks, this person shut himself in his room, where he paced back and forth until he was nearly exhausted.
This person and Hamilton were diametrically opposed on the issue of individual liberties.
